caption.title: Environmental fluctuations, rodent host dynamics, and hantavirus infections.
caption.p: (A) Rodent population density observed (black line), model-simulated density (red line), and rainfall in July (blue line, unit: mm), 1984–2014. The orange-shaded vertical bars indicate periods of drought. Model-predicted and observed density have a correlation of R = 0.73, P < 0.01. (B) Normalized difference vegetation index values for farmland during the drought, from July to August (green dotted line). The black line indicates the average NDVI value of farmland from July to August, 1984–2014. Error bars give ±2 standard deviations. (C) The effect of seasonal changes in NDVI on rodent survival estimated from Eq 2. Error bars show the 95% credible intervals.
